meanings.definition: Able to be told or narrated.
meanings.sent1: The story was very tellable, and everyone enjoyed listening to it.
meanings.sent2: The book had a tellable plot that kept the readers engaged.
meanings.sent3: The tellable tale made the children giggle with excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her expression was a tellable map of her emotions.
meanings.sent5: The details were so tellable that they painted a vivid picture in my mind.

meanings.sent1: The tellable news spread quickly throughout the small town.
meanings.sent2: The joke was so tellable that everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent3: The tellable advice helped him make the right decision.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a tellable sign of her happiness.
meanings.sent5: The instructions were clear and tellable, making the task easy to complete.

meanings.definition: Capable of being communicated or expressed.
meanings.sent1: His feelings were tellable through his expressive eyes.
meanings.sent2: The emotions in the song were so tellable that it moved the audience to tears.
meanings.sent3: The tellable message resonated with people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent4: The painting was a tellable masterpiece of the artist's talent.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room was tellable as everyone eagerly awaited the announcement.
